speaker: Doctor
text: So you've been experiencing frequent nosebleeds, bleeding gums, and small red spots on your skin. Can you tell me, have you noticed any other symptoms such as easy bruising or swelling after minor injuries?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, I get hurt a lot easier than my brother does, and my mom says my skin is all purple and blue sometimes. And I have those little red dots everywhere, even on my legs.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your vision or hearing lately?

speaker: Patient
text: No, my eyes and ears feel okay.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any fever or swollen lymph nodes recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't think I've ever had a fever, but sometimes my throat feels a little sore. And yeah, I do have a bit of a lump under my neck sometimes.

speaker: Doctor
text: You've had these nosebleeds and other symptoms for a few months now, correct?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, it feels like forever. Sometimes they happen when I'm playing outside and I get too excited, and other times they just happen when I'm sitting still. My mom is always worried about me.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to perform a quick physical exam. Can you please sit up straight and let me take a look at your gums and the inside of your mouth?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't like when you look in my mouth, it feels weird.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've noticed that your gums appear to be quite inflamed and I see some pinpoint bleeding spots on the surface. Have you experienced any unusual bleeding after brushing your teeth or eating certain foods?

speaker: Patient
text: Ow, stop looking at my gums, it hurts.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to ask, have you had any problems with bleeding after taking medications or vitamins, such as aspirin or multivitamins?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't think I take any special medicines, just the ones my mom gives me when I'm sick. And sometimes she gives me a special drink with iron in it.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've taken a look at your gums and I'm concerned about the inflammation and bleeding spots. Have you noticed any bleeding from your gums when you're eating or drinking something cold?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, it hurts when I drink cold things, and sometimes it bleeds a little bit. My mom says it's because I eat ice cream too often.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any blood tests or received any medical treatments recently, such as injections or transfusions?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't think so, doctor. I just go to the dentist for my teeth, and my mom gives me medicine when I'm sick.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any recent changes in your appetite or weight?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't really think about food that much, but sometimes I get really hungry when I'm playing outside. And yeah, I've been getting a little bit taller, but my mom says that's normal.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any problems with bleeding after using a straw or drinking something through a tube?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, it hurts when I drink from a straw, and sometimes I get a little bit of blood in my drink. And I don't like drinking juice through a sippy cup because it makes my gums hurt.

speaker: Doctor
text: You mentioned you've had these symptoms for a few months now. Have you noticed any triggers or patterns to when your nosebleeds and gum bleeding occur?

speaker: Patient
text: Sometimes it happens when I play outside and run around, and other times it just happens when I'm sitting still. And sometimes I get it when I'm eating, especially when I eat certain things like ice cream.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've noticed that your gums appear to be quite inflamed and I see some pinpoint bleeding spots on the surface. Can you tell me, have you experienced any unusual bleeding after playing sports or engaging in any strenuous physical activities?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, it happens when I play outside with my friends, especially when we're playing tag or running around in the park. And sometimes it hurts my knees and elbows when I fall down.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've noticed some inflammation in your gums and some pinpoint bleeding spots. Have you ever had any issues with your teeth or dental work, such as cavities or root canals, that could be contributing to the bleeding?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, I had a cavity last year and I had to get a filling. And my mom says I need to brush my teeth better so I don't get more cavities.

speaker: Doctor
text: You mentioned that you've had these symptoms for a few months now, and I'm starting to get a bit concerned about the possibility of a bleeding disorder. Have you ever had any family members with similar symptoms or a history of bleeding problems?

speaker: Patient
text: My grandma had something with her blood, I don't know what it was, but my mom said it was bad. And my mom gets hurt a lot easier than my dad does too.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've asked you a lot of questions, and I still need to get a clearer picture of what's going on. Can you tell me, have you ever had any problems with bleeding during your menstrual cycle, if you're old enough to be experiencing it?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I'm a boy, so I don't get those.

speaker: Doctor
text: You're 12 years old, so I'm assuming you're not experiencing menstrual bleeding yet. I'd like to clarify that you're not on any medications that could be causing these symptoms, correct?

speaker: Patient
text: I think my mom only gives me medicine when I'm sick, like when I have a cough or a tummy ache. But I don't think it's related to my nosebleeds or gum bleeding.

speaker: Doctor
text: I've been going over our conversation, and I'm starting to think about some possible causes for your symptoms. Have you ever been bitten by a tick or had any exposure to tick bites recently?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I don't think so. I play outside a lot, but I don't remember getting bitten by a tick.

speaker: Doctor
text: You're 12 years old, and you've been experiencing these symptoms for a few months now. Can you tell me, have you had any problems with bleeding after cutting your skin or getting a cut?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, it hurts when I cut myself, and sometimes it bleeds a lot. My mom says I need to be careful when I'm playing with scissors.

speaker: Doctor
text:
I've asked you all the questions I need to, and now I'd like to perform a final physical exam. Can you please open your mouth and let me take a look at the inside of your cheeks and tongue?

(I will now make my diagnosis based on the information gathered so far.)
